p: Two Gram-negative bacteria, namely E. coli and S. typhimurium, and one Gram-positive bacterium, B. cereus were used as test bacteria to examine the bactericidal properties of chitosan film and the effect of RSO, as well as C30B nanoclay addition on the antibacterial action of chitosan. These bacteria were selected because they are the common foodborne pathogens, which are responsible for most of the foodborne diseases [ 56]. The results of antibacterial tests are shown in Figure 6.
